Levi,

>Is it true that server end of this sequence is what you're trying to 
test?  
>In particular your concerned with clients disappearing somewhere 
between database.connect() and database.disconnect()?

Exactly, if a client crashed and lost his connection, I want to test the 
server can indeed detect that crashed client, and releases any record lock 
held by the client.

>Is DatabaseClient an interface? Or is it a concrete class?
It is a concrete class and can be run to connect to the server and access the 
database.

>For what its worth, I'm already leaning towards mock-objects. Are you 
familiar w/ them?
My understanding of mock-objects is those are the scale-down version of the 
actual object with similar behaviours.  For example, it requires a lot more 
works (setting up, tearing down, etc) to test a class that accesses a 
full-scale relational database, but if a mock object of the database (may be 
a 2-dimension String array) is used, as long as the object's methods behaves 
like the database's, writing test case for it becomes much simpler.  Am I any 
close?  I don't see how can I 'mock' a crashed client though.

Thanks again for your response.

Regards,

Sam
